criteria: A. Presence of obsessions, compulsions, or both:
1. Recurrent and persistent thoughts, urges, or images that are experienced as intrusive and unwanted, causing marked anxiety or distress
2. The individual attempts to ignore or suppress these thoughts/urges/images or to neutralize them (e.g., with another thought or action)
1. Repetitive behaviours or mental acts that the individual feels driven to perform in response to an obsession or according to rigid rules
2. These behaviours or mental acts are aimed at preventing or reducing anxiety or distress, or preventing a dreaded event â€” not realistically connected or clearly excessive
B. Obsessions or compulsions are time-consuming (>1 hour/day) or cause clinically significant distress or impairment
C. Not attributable to substance or another medical condition
D. Not better explained by another mental disorder (e.g., GAD, BDD, hoarding disorder, PTSD)
specifiers: Good or fair insight: recognizes obsessive-compulsive beliefs as probably not true
Poor insight: believes obsessive-compulsive beliefs are probably true
Absent insight / delusional beliefs: completely convinced of OCD beliefs
Tic-related: current or past history of tic disorder
Common themes: contamination, harm, symmetry/ordering, forbidden thoughts, religious (scrupulosity)
